image.altText: A police car parked outside of a home, with red and white tape cordoning off the front gate.

props.synopsis: A man has been arrested over the alleged domestic violence-related death of his female partner overnight, after she was found unresponsive in the front yard of a Palmerston home.

title.children: Police arrest man over death of female partner near Darwin

image.altText: Close-up of sliced mango.

props.synopsis: The first crop forecast for the mango season is predicting the Darwin region to produce 2.2 million trays.

title.children: Mango season is here as NT harvest ramps up

image.altText: A young man wearing a blue shirt and sunglasses outside the local court

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory’s Director of Public Prosecutions is considering whether to appeal a decision to allow a young fatal hit-and-run driver who bragged to his friends afterwards to avoid jail time.

title.children: DPP considers appeal after fatal hit-run driver's 'shockingly callous' texts

image.altText: Woman stands in park with microphone in front of chest

props.synopsis: Australia's richest person, Gina Rinehart, has helped fund Senator Jacinta Nampijinpa Price's crowd-funded defence to a defamation action brought by the head of a Northern Territory land council.

title.children: Gina Rinehart helps fund Jacinta Nampijinpa Price's defamation defence

image.altText: A woman with short hair wearing a green blazer speaks to the camera in front of a Liberal party backdrop.

props.synopsis: Kerrynne Liddle speaks for the first time since Jacinta Nampijinpa Price was dumped from the frontbench, saying the pair are "on a unity ticket" when it comes to Indigenous affairs.

title.children: Shadow Minister on 'unity ticket' with dumped Senator Nampijinpa Price

image.altText: A palawa woman stands facing the camera in front of an artwork

props.synopsis: Forty years ago, the federal government used the constitution to halt construction of the Franklin Dam. Now lawyers want the Albanese government to do the same to keep kids out of jails.

title.children: Experts say jails cause kids 'irreversible trauma'. They want Albanese to act

image.altText: a gate with a cut-out of a man on a horse silhouetted against a sunset.

props.synopsis: One of Australia's largest private landholders expands his vast portfolio of outback stations, buying Murranji in the NT for $44 million plus the value of its cattle.

title.children: Viv Oldfield expands outback cattle empire, buying Murranji for $44m

image.altText: A man leaning over to hug his bull arab dog, who has white fur, staring affectionately at man, with tongue slightly out.

props.synopsis: A Darwin animal shelter has been accused of "unprofessional" behaviour after failing to provide desexing services which new owners had already paid for as part of their adoption fee.

title.children: Pet re-homing charity labelled 'unprofessional' over failure to desex animals

image.altText: Sport underway inside proposed stadium.

props.synopsis: The Tasmanian Planning Commission described the Hobart stadium as a "singular, large, bulky monolith" with "optimism bias" in the government's cost-benefit figures. What does this mean for the stadium?

title.children: Is Hobart's proposed AFL stadium now dead?

image.altText: A young caucasian man wearing a green shirt smiles

props.synopsis: Key moments that led to the identification and arrest of the man accused of murdering Charlie Kirk have been laid out in fresh court documents released by US authorities.

title.children: Alleged Charlie Kirk killer's confession to lover revealed in text messages

image.altText: A white tent with "American Comeback Tour" written on it is seen behind police tape and a uniformed officer.

props.synopsis: US police have charged a 71-year-old man they say has admitted to yelling out that he shot conservative activist Charlie Kirk in order to "allow the actual suspect to flee".

title.children: Man admits he claimed to be Charlie Kirk gunman so real suspect could flee

image.altText: People walk on the footpath under the UTS building.

props.synopsis: The University of Technology Sydney will close its schools of education and public health under a multi-million-dollar restructure.

title.children: UTS cuts more than 1,100 subjects and 134 full-time jobs in restructure

image.altText: A black background with GIM in white and an orange symbol.

props.synopsis: After the ABC revealed GIM Trading had raised millions from customers who later suspected fraudulent activity, a judge has prohibited the current director from leaving the country.

title.children: ASIC secures court order to stop GIM Trading director from leaving country

image.altText: A tractor and trucks piled high with belongings on a dirt road with blue sky

props.synopsis: Israeli troops encircle Gaza City as the UN chief slams the offensive as "systematic destruction", with thousands of Palestinians unable or unwilling to flee.

title.children: Israel 'burning' Gaza, defence chief says, as army deepens ground assault

image.altText: A young girl dressed in pink lays on the ground as her father draws around her with chalk.

props.synopsis: A state government body sat on a report into lead dust that was "poisoning" children for nearly four years and tried to keep its release quiet.

title.children: Australian children 'living in poison' with lead in bloodstream at high levels

image.altText: A close up of Sussan Ley.

props.synopsis: In her first major economic speech, the opposition leader hits out at universal subsidies and says "dependency" has affected Australia's "national character".

title.children: Australians too dependent on government, says Sussan Ley

image.altText: A light brown beetle and smaller brown larvae pictured in a microscopic picture with grains of rice in background.

props.synopsis: Authorities are investigating how khapra beetle, the number-one-priority pest for the grains industry, entered Australia.

title.children: Major threat to Australian grains industry found in imported nappy pants

image.altText: A mine and train.

props.synopsis: One of Queensland's biggest coal miners says it does not want to see jobs lost but blamed "the Queensland government's unsustainable coal royalties and market conditions".

title.children: BHP alliance to sack 750 workers blaming Qld mining royalties

image.altText: Peter Bol in the 800m heat in the middle of the pack at the Athletics World Championships.

props.synopsis: Peter Bol finished fourth in the 800 metres at Tokyo's National Stadium four years after doing the same thing at the Olympic Games, but the results could not have been more different.

title.children: Australia's athletics renaissance 'scary and exciting' for Peter Bol

image.altText: A video of Trump and Epstein is projected onto a stone castle's side.

props.synopsis: The shots included Donald Trump's mugshot, portraits of Epstein, newspaper headlines, and footage of the two men dancing together.

title.children: UK protesters arrested after beaming Epstein video ahead of Trump visit

image.altText: The words "FEDERAL RESERVE" engraved on a stone building.

props.synopsis: The world's largest central bank is less than 24 hours from announcing one of the most anticipated interest rate decisions of the year.

title.children: Federal Reserve stares down worst-case scenario: US economy in stagflation

image.altText: A man sits in an office with a pen in his mouth.

props.synopsis: The Hollywood icon leaves a legacy of classic films with a career that stretched over decades.

title.children: Looking back at some of Robert Redford's most notable movies from the 1960s to the late 2010s

image.altText: Hobart Clinic closure  2025-09-17 10:09:00

props.synopsis: The Hobart Clinic, which employs 100 people and has provided private mental health services for Tasmanians for 40 years, will close its inpatient site by the end of October, citing financial woes.

title.children: Tasmania's only large-scale private mental health clinic to close after 40 years

image.altText: Bell resigns thumbnail

props.synopsis: Jimmy Barnes is among more than 40 music voices supporting an open letter to the embattled Australian National University (ANU) calling for the School of Music to be saved.

title.children: Jimmy Barnes among stars calling for change at ANU

image.altText: A tesla autopilot screen as a car drives on a road at sunset

props.synopsis: The lawsuits relate to separate crashes in California in 2019, including one that killed a 15-year-old boy.

title.children: Tesla settles lawsuits over fatal crashes involving autopilot software

image.altText: An army tank that vaguely resembles a bulldozer amongst Queensland bushland.

props.synopsis: The arrival of new army capabilities shook homes throughout a north Queensland city this month. Now residents can see what they felt.

title.children: Army shows new equipment after shaking homes in initial test

image.altText: A blooming canola crop spells out the words "will you marry me", as seen from above.

props.synopsis: NSW farmer Will Henderson had no choice but to bide his time to pop the question. In the end his efforts were rewarded.

title.children: Farmer goes above and beyond for sky-high wedding proposal

image.altText: Customers browse items at David Jones

props.synopsis: Two and a half million Australians have signed up for this cashback app, which leaves them wondering what's next.

title.children: What we know about Cashrewards's abrupt shutdown

image.altText: A man with big eyebrows and a brunette beard

props.synopsis: Officers allege the 45-year-old shot a man in the leg in Cairns earlier this month, and was involved in a traffic incident north of Rockhampton yesterday.

title.children: Police search for 'dangerous' alleged shooter accused of fleeing car crash

image.altText: A toucan with a bright orange beak looks through a cage.

props.synopsis: Brazilian authorities say they have disrupted a major animal trafficking ring, rescuing hundreds of exotic animals and making dozens of arrests.

title.children: Toucans, tortoises rescued in major Brazilian trafficking bust

image.altText: Neville Bonner in bronze.

props.synopsis: Neville Bonner is honoured as Australia's first Indigenous parliamentarian.

title.children: First Indigenous parliamentarian commemorated with bronze sculpture

image.altText: A man looks into the camera

props.synopsis: Brett Daniel Taylor is accused of trafficking veterinary drugs to Queenslanders for assisted dying. The ABC can reveal he is separately being prosecuted for engaging in legal practice when not entitled.

title.children: Qld man accused of assisting suicides also allegedly posed as lawyer

image.altText: A children's toy bear laying sideways on a floor.

props.synopsis: About 400 educators were issued prohibition orders banning them from early education or care in the past five years, the ABC can reveal.

title.children: Parents kept in the dark over hundreds of blacklisted childcare workers

image.altText: A red basket containing eggs, bread and mince, in a shopping aisle

props.synopsis: Disease-resistant pigs, faster-growing fish and heat-tolerant cows are among a new class of animals that are being genetically engineered for the dining table. Similar meat products could soon be sold in Australia without lengthy regulatory testing.

title.children: How gene-edited fish and meat are entering our food chains

image.altText: Water-sodden cane fields.

props.synopsis: Huge rainfall totals of more than 300 millimetres have taken even rain-hardened Far North Queenslanders by surprise at a typically drier time of the year.

title.children: Heavy rain, flash flood warning for Far North Qld
